newsitem.title: USA: Utah Medical sees fetal pH device fueling growth.
newsitem.headline: Utah Medical sees fetal pH device fueling growth.

text.p: Utah Medical Products Inc expects a new device it is developing to assess fetal distress by measuring pH or acidity levels will set a new standard for prenatal care, chairman and chief executive officer Kevin Cornwell said Tuesday.

The device, which if approved would be a new version of its existing Intran heart monitoring device, should "set the stage for another round of high growth," Cornwell told the Cruttenden Roth Growth stock Conference here.

Along with monitoring amniotic fluid, the new system is designed to measure pH levels, which help doctors assess whether a fetus' lungs and heart are functioning properly. The previous system did not measure pH levels.
Cornwell said this system would be a more precise indicator of fetal distress, which could help reduce the number of unwarranted caesarian section deliveries.
"We believe that physicians will not deliver babies without this information once the system is proven accurate," Cornwell said.

Although he did not say when the company would be ready to apply for marketing approval, Cornwell did say he expected it would qualify for a rapid review by the Food and Drug Administration. He said it posed no safety concerns different from the existing Intran devices, and offered more accurate readings of a fetus, meaning it "can not be less efficacious" than those already on the market.
